resources.string: Welcome to WellScreen! This data policy explains what data we collect, how we collect it, how we store it, how we use it, and how you have control over it.

1. App Usage Data

What We Collect: Information about your app usage, including which apps you use and for how long.

Details:

  • Per-App Usage: Total time you spend on each app per day.
  • Category Usage: Total time you spend on categories of apps per day (e.g., Social, Productivity).

How We Collect It: Using your device's Usage Stats, we monitor app foreground activity.


2. Screen On/Off Events

What We Collect: Times when your screen turns on and off.

How We Collect It: By listening to system events that occur when you turn your screen on or off.


3. Total Screen Time

What We Collect: The total amount of time your screen is active each day.

How We Collect It: Calculated from screen on/off events and app usage data.


4. Mood Assessments (MPHQ-9 Questionnaire)

What We Collect: Your responses to the MPHQ-9 mood assessment questionnaire.

Details:

  • Individual question scores (ranging from 0 to 100).
  • Average score calculated from your responses.

How We Collect It: When you voluntarily complete the questionnaire within the app.
All your data is stored locally on your device using an encrypted database. We do not transmit your data over the internet or store it on external servers.

Data Trends/Visualizations: To provide you with detailed reports and charts on your app usage, screen time, and mood patterns.

Correlation Analyses: Analyzing the relationship between your app usage/screen time and your mood assessments to identify potential impacts on your well-being.

Automatic Deletion: You can choose how long we keep your data. The options include:

  • One Week
  • One Month
  • Three Months
  • Six Months
  • One Year
  • Never (data is kept indefinitely unless you choose to delete it)

Customization: Set your preferred data retention period in the app settings.

Old Data Deletion: Data older than your selected retention period will be automatically deleted from your device.

Usage Access Permission: To collect app usage statistics.

Battery Optimization Exemption: To ensure the app runs smoothly in the background without being stopped by the system.

Foreground Service Permission (Android 14 and above): To collect screen on/off data.

Notifications Permission: To remind you to complete depression symptom assessments.

Manage Permissions: You can enable or disable permissions at any time through your device settings.

Data Deletion: You can manually delete data for any days of your choice, and you can customize data retention settings to your preference.

Add Custom Data: You can manually add data entities to the app database. If you're adding data for a day, it may be helpful to delete existing data for the day to avoid overlap.
